# Draft:Nadeem Sarwar

Nadeem Sarwar () is a Pakistani noha reciter from Karachi. He is known for Urdu and multilingual devotional recordings and live recitations during Muharram. Sarwar has released albums for more than three decades and performs across South Asia, the Middle East, Europe, and in diaspora communities. Recent listings on Apple Music show releases through [https://music.apple.com/us/artist/nadeem-sarwar/463479220 2024] and [https://music.apple.com/mu/artist/nadeem-sarwar/463479220 2025].
Early life
Public community profiles identify his parents as Syed Asrar Hussain Rizvi and Syeda Nargis Khatoon. Reports place his upbringing in Karachi, where he began reciting at an early age with guidance from his [https://www.sadaewatansydney.com/sarwar-in-sydney.htm family].
Career
Sarwar rose to wider notice in the nineteen eighties with recorded nohas circulated among Pakistani and overseas audiences. He records and performs in several languages, including Urdu, Punjabi, Sindhi, Saraiki, Pashto, Gujarati, Persian, Hindi, and Arabic, extending reach to varied communities according to his [https://nohakhawan.blogspot.com/2013/01/nadeem-sarwar.html biography].
He tours regularly for Muharram gatherings and community programs. Coverage in community media documents appearances in the United Kingdom, North America, and [http://www.sadaewatansydney.com/sarwar-in-sydney.htm Australia.].
Recognition
On [https://gtvnewshd.com/pakistan/2024/09/06/nadeem-sarwar-to-receive-honorary-doctorate-tamgha-e-imtiaz/ September 6 2024], Sindh Governor Kamran Khan Tessori announced an honorary doctorate for Syed Nadeem Raza Sarwar and stated that he would recommend the Tamgha e Imtiaz. The event was reported by Pakistani [https://startuppakistan.com.pk/nadeem-raza-sarwar-recognized-with-honorary-doctorate-and-tamgha-e-imtiaz-by-governor-of-sindh/ media] with images and video from the Governor House.
Personal life
Sarwar is married and has three children. His sons Ali Shanawar and Ali Jee also recite and release albums.
